headline: Big Bank stocks sell off on earnings: A look at smaller banks
summary: Bank stocks Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), and Bank of America (BAC) are selling off on Wednesday after the companies released their fourth quarter earnings results. JPMorgan Chase stock (JPM) continues to slide since reporting its earnings on Tuesday. Whalen Global Advisors Chairman Chris Whalen sits down with Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman to examine what may be causing these declines in bank stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Wells Fargo is having an 'identity crisis,' strategist says
summary: Wells Fargo (WFC) stock is falling in Wednesday's pre-market trading after reporting its fourth quarter results — alongside Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C) — with the bank's revenue falling short of Wall Street's adjusted earnings and revenue estimates. Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Threadneedle Ventures founder Ann Berry discuss Wells Fargo's fourth quarter release, noting how severance expenses dragged down the bank's figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Bank earnings, commodities gains, retail sales & PPI: 3 Things
summary: Big Bank stocks Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), and Bank of America (BAC) released their fourth quarter earnings results this morning. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) fall in Wednesday's pre-market trading, while oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) continue to tick back up and gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) climb to new record highs. US retail sales topped expectations for November, while December's Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation reading came out hotter than expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Bank of America Expects Net Interest Income Growth in 2026
summary: Bank of America said it expects net interest income, a core revenue source, to grow between 5% and 7% on a fully tax-equivalent basis in 2026.  The bank said it expects net interest income on that basis to rise 7% in the first quarter.  The first quarter includes two fewer days of interest accrual, Bank of America noted.

raw.headline: Bank of America Expects Net Interest Income Growth in 2026
raw.summary: Bank of America said it expects net interest income, a core revenue source, to grow between 5% and 7% on a fully tax-equivalent basis in 2026.  The bank said it expects net interest income on that basis to rise 7% in the first quarter.  The first quarter includes two fewer days of interest accrual, Bank of America noted.

headline: JPMorgan Stock Rises After Sharp Drop on Earnings. What Spooked Markets.
summary: JPMorgan Chase  stock was showing signs of recovery in Wednesday’s premarket following a sharp fall the previous session on disappointing fourth-quarter results.  While the bank’s adjusted earnings beat analysts’ estimates, profits fell 7% from a year earlier on the back of lower-than-expected investment banking fees.  The banking giant had to set up a $2.2 billion credit reserve as part of agreeing to buy the iPhone maker’s card portfolio.

headline: Bank earnings, retail sales, SCOTUS tariff ruling: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, January 14, including earnings results from major banks Citigroup (C), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Bank of America (BAC); the latest print on US retail sales data from November; and the US Supreme Court's (SCOTUS) expected ruling on President Trump's tariff policies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
